alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 2:06PM MDT until June 22 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Crowheart, Kinnear...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to around 9.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then slowly fall to 8.5 feet by the weekend. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
